name: No Cure
description:
The road to acceptance can be long and circuitous.
One can only accept it as a true blessing to change to be the best … to live a good life.

This piece is hand-drawn digitally using a stylus pen in the Sketchbook program on an iPad Pro device.

2048 x 2037 px
jpeg

“That’s Me” Series
Teguh Ostenrik in collaboration with @dettytoski
 
In a contemplation space, what does it mean to save oneself? It's just ironic as there's no cure. And I start reflecting on my life. The power I can have. The thought to escape and take control. I'll turn your world into ash and treat you like you're the lamb. You can sit here wallowing in your ignorance. Looking for any reason, you can deny. Because life and death decisions are once yours but the two sisters will no longer hurt me.
 
In this series, Ostenrik portrays the contrast of bright neon colours as the struggle one most often has in dealing with Bipolar Disorder. The battle to survive the bewildering highs and lows in the brain turbulence is represented in each bold stroke.
